intro: Carpolobia macrostachya, commonly known as the giant marshmallow plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It is characterized by its large, woolly, pale green leaves that can grow up to 3 meters in length. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in wet, swampy environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
